group_1.textLeft: *Sigh*
I never thought something so sweet and delicious@could be so torturous.
Getting used to cities isn't easy at all...
My mother will give me that talk all over again.
Yeah.
She says whenever you go to a new place like a city,
you need to be at least somewhat prepared.
Did either of your parents give you any advice about@going there?
I think that advice is specifically tailored to you,@not Kamihama.
What about you, Sunao?

group_1.textRight: To tell you the truth...I haven't talked to them about@it yet.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:102501:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]What?! Why?
Isn't this something your family needs to know?

group_1.textRight: But I just haven't had the chance to bring it up.

group_1.textLeft: That's unusual for you, Sunao.
Normally for something like this, you'd be the first@one to tell your family.
...Well, it's up to you to figure out when to talk to@them about it.
But I think you should tell your parents as soon as@possible, in case they say no.
Ah, welcome back, you three!
I'm sorry they dragged you along with them, Sunao.

group_1.textRight: It was nothing. Please don't worry about it.
I've heard you've been eager to hear my opinion on@what we should do with the daidaikko.

group_1.textLeft: Yes. You see, we've had such a successful harvest@this year that there's far more than all of us can eat.
If we can't figure out what to do with them,@it'll all go to waste.
We've been trying to think of a solution, but...
Since you live outside the village, I think you'd be@able to give us an objective opinion.

group_1.textRight: Haven't we been discussing tourism as a way for the@village to earn money to sustain itself?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, that's right!
We can show off the horse farm, the crafts, the hot@springs, and other things...right?

group_1.textRight: Indeed, and as part of that, perhaps we can sell the@daidaikko.

group_1.textLeft: I fully agree with your idea, but...
The road to the village needs lots of improvements@in order to get people to come.
If we wanted to sell it in the other towns instead,
we'd need to make arrangements with stores or@other marketplaces.
And even then, we'd still have problems considering@how hard it is to transport our goods.
The only ones who can quickly move between the@village and the towns...
...are the three of us, since we're Diviners.
Hey! Welcome home!

group_1.textRight: They've returned...? Did they leave the village?

group_1.textLeft: These days, we don't have enough for the village@to be self-sufficient.
Some of the villagers are renting a house over in@town, and they work there.
This way, they can also bring back the things that@the rest of us need on a regular basis.
So how's your job going?

group_1.textRight: And this time, I've got a little surprise for you guys.
